Once there was a way to get back homeward
 Once there was a way to get back home

It is said “you can never go home” after a long time away (because a person changes over time, “home” has a different feeling when a person goes back. This line seems to introduce the idea that time/events have transpired that make it impossible for the narrator or the sleepy head to go back to the former home.

Sleep pretty darling, do not cry
 And I will sing a lullaby

This part of the song quotes “Cradle Song”, a lullaby by the dramatist Thomas Dekker.

Paul McCartney saw sheet music for the lullaby at his father’s home in Liverpool, left on a piano by his stepsister Ruth. Unable to read music, he created his own music. However, Abbey Road does not credit Dekker with the stanza or with the title.
